title: Judge Dismisses Lawsuit, Allows Tree Removal
excerpt:
News 12 reports that a judge dismissed the lawsuit, allowing NYC Parks to proceed with cutting down trees. 
FFGP expresses disappointment but vows to continue fighting.

title: Meeting with Parks Commissioner Sue Donoghue
excerpt: FFGP met with Parks Commissioner Sue Donoghue, who confirmed the department's eagerness to move ahead despite opposition.

title: Residents Demand Answers on Tree Removal Plan
excerpt: Brooklyn Paper reports that residents demanded answers and that Parks Commissioner Mitchell Silver was forcing through the unpopular plan.

title: Lawsuit Results in Stay of Execution for Trees
excerpt: Kings County Politics reports that residents came together and prevailed in court, resulting in a temporary halt to tree removal.

title: Assemblyman Warns Against Tree Replacement Plan
excerpt: Assemblyman Walter Mosley argued that trees with longevity should not be replaced by immature saplings and warned the plan could spur gentrification.

title: Landmarks Commission Criticizes Parks Without Borders Design
excerpt: During a 2017 hearing, LPC commissioners criticized the Parks Without Borders design as 'antithetical' to Olmsted's vision and 'not very friendly' for gatherings.
